summary: The 'Trump Derangement Syndrome Research Act of 2025' directs the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to conduct or support research on Trump Derangement Syndrome (TDS). The bill defines TDS as intense emotional or cognitive reactions to Donald J. Trump. The research aims to understand its origins, impacts, and potential mitigation strategies, including media influences and links to extreme behaviors, potentially informing public health strategies. The NIH will collaborate with other agencies and report annually to Congress. The bill also cites two assassination attempts against Donald J. Trump as relevant context for the research.
